---
title: "Methodology"
---

## Data sources

- DataSUS ([opendatasus](https://opendatasus.saude.gov.br/))
- Tabnet/CNES (hospital resources: beds, equipment, professionals)
- IBGE (demography data)

## Statistical model

- Graph representation of municipality adjacency
- Spanning trees and partitioning via pruning
- Bayesian specification (priors, cohesion functions, parameters).
- Inference algorithm (Gibbs sampler)

## Software

- R
  - `[microdatasus]`(https://github.com/rfsaldanha/microdatasus)

## Evaluation strategy

- Compare estimated partitions with official health regions, REGIC 2018
- Metrics: rand index, Jaccard, F1-score
- Error measures (MAE, MSE) on aggregated health indicators
- Visualization: probability maps showing clustering uncertainty, transition zones
